pieces.title: Metal coins
pieces.description:
A role-playing game without physical coins is like Monopoly without money: it works, but it loses all its flavor.

Treasure lies at the heart of almost every D&D campaign‚Ä¶ yet when it's reduced to numbers written and erased a hundred times, it loses all magic and impact.

For the sake of simplicity, we almost always stick to the gold piece, forgetting the richness of other currencies.

With our physical coins, the math stays simple, but every haul becomes tangible, memorable ‚Äî worthy of the grandest quests.

flim2025.heading: News ‚Äì FLIM 2025
flim2025.title: Heroes level 20, an overly tenacious raccoon, and... our coins
flim2025.summary: Our first demonstration of coins at FLIM 2025 took the form of a legendary one-shot hosted by Es-tu Game?.
flim2025.video1: The mayor honors the three heroes with real silver
flim2025.video2: When everything is decided by a coin... dragon or star?
flim2025.video3: Game finale: The raccoon, the stars... and chaos
flim2025.youtube: Watch the full session on the official YouTube channel:
flim2025.p1: During the first day of the Montreal International Ludic Festival, our very first public demonstration of coins took the form of a legendary one-shot. We tossed our pieces like dice of destiny. They whirled through the air and landed with a deep metallic chime, immediately sparking a wave of wonder. Eyes widened. Voices rose in laughter and astonishment. The very essence of role‚Äëplaying had just changed.
flim2025.p2: None of it would have been possible without our ally in this adventure: Es-tu Game?, Qu√©bec‚Äôs go-to channel for wild gaming sessions on YouTube‚Äîand above all, the inimitable, fabulous Pierre‚ÄëLouis Renaud. A master of plotting and a world‚Äëforger, he‚Äôs that legendary GM no archdevil dares challenge. Even in Sigil, the eldest sages of the multiverse whisper his name with respect‚Äîand more than a hint of envy. For if there is a plane where a better game master exists, it‚Äôs only because Pierre‚ÄëLouis rolled his dice there first. And for our greatest delight, he unleashed one of his most madcap one-shots: a level‚Äë20 adventure of absurdly epic intensity.
flim2025.p3: A true fireworks display of controlled chaos, featuring three cult figures from his past campaigns:
flim2025.li1: Gratis, played by Dave Belisle (Les Appendices): a gnome artificer as exuberant as he is unmanageable, an alchemist of sauces with effects that are often explosive‚Ä¶ and always unpredictable. To him, offering a drop of his latest concoction is a sign of affection‚Äîwhether the recipient survives or not. His sauces, as unstable as can be, tend to trigger unforeseen effects: reversed gravity, torrents of tears as black as fresh ink, or vertical wall waltzes. Even enemies are not immune to his spicy generosity.
flim2025.li2: Marlin, brilliantly portrayed by Jean‚ÄëFran√ßois Proven√ßal (Les Appendices), an illusionist rogue as elusive as he is improbable. A strategist of alternative logic, selectively brave but disarmingly charming, he excels in fleeing with grace, stealing with flair, and finding himself‚Äîwithout ever seeking it‚Äîin the heart of the most absurd situations. It‚Äôs as if the entire universe conspires to make him the pivot of chaos.
flim2025.li3: Tana, the unforgettable axe-wielding barbarian, embodied by Rosanne Berry. Feared for her unshakable motto: strike first, think later, ask questions‚Ä¶ rarely. She‚Äôs as famous for her crushing charges as she is for her heartfelt tears. A colossus with a tender heart, a veritable emotional and cutting tidal wave, who certainly didn‚Äôt expect to encounter a raccoon‚Ä¶ immune to her blows capable of cleaving the fabric of space-time.
flim2025.p4: This improbable trio thought they could enjoy a peaceful retirement in a sleepy village‚Äîuntil they couldn‚Äôt resist the urge to filch a few coins from the star-struck onlookers.
flim2025.p5: Marlin and Tana, forever chasing a thrill, amused themselves by lifting the small purses of travelers dazzled by their legend, before the thought of ‚Äòtheft‚Äô even crossed their minds. Gratis, feeling slightly guilty, followed almost reluctantly, limiting his petty crimes to lighthearted acts of bravado.
flim2025.p6: But the attempted burglary of the mayor‚Äôs residence went awry. A rustle in the trash, an overly curious raccoon, and a poorly sorted compost threw the operation into chaos, abruptly halting our heroic scoundrels‚Äô exploits.
flim2025.p7: The climax? A cosmic raccoon sucked into the stars by inverted gravity, while the mayor, in tears, emptied his safe in a whirl of copper and silver coins in homage to his lost sons, and the spectators and table erupted in laughter‚Äîcompletely swept away by the immersion.

quote1.title: ‚ÄúNo more battles with our character sheets!‚Äù
quote1.intro: Many players said it: physical coins change everything.
quote1.p1: Gone are the columns of numbers hastily scribbled on a crumpled sheet. Now every player felt the real weight of the loot, sliding between their fingers like a forgotten heirloom. Treasure became tangible. At each exchange, the whole body reacted: the hand hesitating, the eye weighing, the throat drying. The hoard took on flesh. It became dramatic stakes, visceral emotion, an event, a lasting memory...
quote1.p2strong: No more fights with character sheets
quote1.p2rest: endless book searches while others disconnect, or the long 0 / 0.1 / 0.2 / 0.3... character creation sessions that discourage before the game even begins. With Geek & Dragon, everything starts when the coin hits the table.

quote2.text: My big discovery at FLIM: my children fell in love with the coins and have been doing lots of chores so they can trade their points for a treasure hunt and have their own treasure chest. Thanks to Mathieu for offering this great addition to introducing kids to role-playing games.
